title.narrative: ECD POLICY ENVIRONMENT AND COORDINATIONMECHANISM

description.narrative: Improved Early Child Development (ECD) policy environment and coordination mechanisms that support optimal development of children, which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Young children and families, especially the most vulnerable, are utilizing quality Early Child Development (ECD) services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved ECD policy environment and coordination mechanisms that support optimal development of children

description.narrative: Implementation of the 2016 national ECD policy plus continued high-level government commitment to the programme improved the policy environment and coordination for optimal child growth and development. The government continued to provide funding to the NCD Agency and all 30 districts. The national child development sub-cluster, co-chaired by the NCD Agency, UNICEF and Imbuto Foundation, enhanced coordination and increased the participation and integration of key thematic areas – health, social protection, nutrition, education, WASH and child protection for holistic child development. Coordination at decentralized levels was relatively weak. The NCD Agency responded by engaging CSO partners to support the districts. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2021
